newsitem.title: UK: DMG still in race for KEPIT.
newsitem.headline: DMG still in race for KEPIT.

text.p: Deutsche Morgan Grenfell has not requested that its bid to manage the 500 million pound Kleinwort European Privatisation Investment Trust Plc be withdrawn in the wake of investigations into three of its unit trusts.
"We have not made any communication with Merrill. All the proposals are in and they are being looked at," said a spokesman for Morgan Grenfell Asset Management.
Morgan Grenfell on Monday suspended dealings in three funds pending investigation into "possible irregularities centring on certain unquoted securities". Dealing will restart on Thursday.
Merrill Lynch, which is advising the KEPIT board on choosing between 12 competing proposals to restructure the ailing trust, said earlier today it was still in the process of examining them.

Morgan Grenfell's proposals had centred on broadening the mandate of the trust away from poorly performing privatisation stocks into a more general European fund plus some exposure to central and eastern Europe. -- David Chance London newsroom 44 171 542 5887
